page.title: 02BILTON TODAY.
page.content: After the Second World War many changes were made in Bilton. Houses were built in large numbers and the population figure has risen to well over 5000. New schools, better roads, recreation facilities and shops and public transport have been provided. Most of Bilton's farms have become housing estates, but these are on the edge of the{Nidd Gorge}still well wooded and the centre of a conservation scheme to preserve wildlife and the rural landscape for future generations. Public footpaths are being approved from Batchelor Gardens, through the Nidd Woods to the {Nidd Viaduct,}no longer used by the railway, and then along the river to Bilton Hall and on to{Knaresborough.
